chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall X Y : Type, FiniteT X -> FiniteT Y -> FiniteT (X * Y)

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
finite_sum : forall X Y : Type, FiniteT X -> FiniteT Y -> FiniteT (X + Y)
bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
FiniteT_ind : forall P : Type -> Prop, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
FiniteT_sind : forall P : Type -> SProp, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
surj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> surjective f -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> FiniteT Y
inj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT Y -> injective f -> (forall y : Y, (exists x : X, f x = y) \/ ~ (exists x : X, f x = y)) -> FiniteT X
FiniteT_img : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> Finite Y (Im Full_set f)
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
finite_subtype : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, P x \/ ~ P x) -> FiniteT {x : X | P x}
finite_surj_inj : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X), FiniteT X -> surjective f -> injective f
finite_inj_surj : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X), FiniteT X -> injective f -> surjective f
finite_eq_dec : forall X : Type, FiniteT X -> forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y}
finite_dec_exists : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {exists x : X, P x} + {forall x : X, ~ P x}
finite_dec_forall : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {forall x : X, P x} + {exists x : X, ~ P x}
Inductive invertible (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) : Prop := intro_invertible : forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f Arguments invertible {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_invertible {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T)
Im_intro : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (x : U), In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im X f) y
Inductive Im (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) : Ensemble V := Im_intro : forall x : U, In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im X f) y Arguments Im {U V}%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_intro (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope
finite_choice : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), FiniteT A -> (forall x : A, exists y : B, R x y) -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, R x (f x)
Finite_ens_type : forall S : Ensemble ?X, Finite ?X S -> FiniteT {x : ?X | In S x} where ?X : [ |- Type]
finite_dep_choice : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (R : forall x : A, B x -> Prop), FiniteT A -> (forall x : A, exists y : B x, R x y) -> exists f : forall x : A, B x, forall x : A, R x (f x)
Empty_set_minimal : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), Included Empty_set X
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos : forall R : Type, R -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.add_pow_list : forall R : Type, R -> BinNums.N -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> list (R * BinNums.positive)

```coq
intros X Y HX HY.
apply FiniteT_ind with (P := fun T => FiniteT (X * T)).
- apply empty_finite.
- intros T HT HP. apply bij_finite with (f := fun p => match p with (x, y) => (x, Some y) end).
  + intros p1 p2. destruct p1, p2. simpl. intros H. inversion H. subst. auto.
  + intros p. destruct p. simpl. exists (x, None). auto.
  + apply HT.
- intros X Y f1 HT1 HP1 HI1. apply bij_finite with (f := fun p => match p with (x, y) => (f1 x, y) end).
  + intros p1 p2. destruct p1, p2. simpl. intros H. inversion H. subst. auto.
  + intros p. destruct p. simpl. exists (f1 x, y). auto.
  + apply HT1.
Qed.

original: intros X Y HX HY. apply FiniteT_ind with (P := fun T => FiniteT (X * T)). - apply empty_finite. - intros T HT HP. apply bij_finite with (f := fun p => match p with (x, y) => (x, Some y) end). + intros p1 p2. destruct p1, p2. simpl. intros H. inversion H. subst. auto. + intros p. destruct p. simpl. exists (x, None). auto. + apply HT. - intros X Y f1 HT1 HP1 HI1. apply bij_finite with (f := fun p => match p with (x, y) => (f1 x, y) end). + intros p1 p2. destruct p1, p2. simpl. intros H. inversion H. subst. auto. + intros p. destruct p. simpl. exists (f1 x, y). auto. + apply HT1.
